meanings.sent1: The lacquey opened the door for the guests.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy family's lacquey carried their bags into the mansion.
meanings.sent3: The lacquey tripped over his own feet while trying to serve tea.
meanings.sent4: She treated her assistant like a lacquey, always ordering him around.
meanings.sent5: The loyal lacquey never complained about his duties, always ready to help.

meanings.sent1: He would lacquey for the king, following his every command.
meanings.sent2: The ambitious young man hoped to lacquey his way into a position of power.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly told her friend to stop lacqueying around and get to work.
meanings.sent4: The politician accused his opponent of lacqueying to the interests of the wealthy.
meanings.sent5: The eager intern was willing to lacquey for experience in the industry.

meanings.definition: To act as a menial attendant
meanings.sent1: In the play, the character would lacquey around the main protagonist.
meanings.sent2: The new employee was asked to lacquey for the senior staff members.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to enjoy watching the dog lacquey after its toys.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to lacquey to everyone's demands to keep her job.
meanings.sent5: The robot was programmed to lacquey to the needs of its human owners.
